page.title: 14WILMSLOW NEWSPAPER STORIES
page.content: In Wilmslow there are two local weekly newspapers. One is called the Express Advertiser, and the other is the Wilmslow World. Both are supported by advertising and are distributed free of charge to all the homes in the area. { On June 13, 1985 the main stories in the Wilmslow World were: { Teacher's Strike}...children being sent home from lessons at short notice { I.C.I.Raid}...13 found guilty of raiding animal research laboratories. { The Local Rose Queen.}500 at the fete { Â£3,000 Crisis Faces Advice Bureau {Centre}....closure within six months faces Wilmslow and Knutsford Citizens' Advice Bureau. { Wilmslow world helps Dutch girl find {her soldier}...an ex Wilmslow soilder and a Dutch woman who met during the war are to be reunited after 40 years.
